results.brief_description: Educational smorgasbord operates in northern NSW and is organised by an ex-primary headmaster. Examines issues in community education - participation, funding, accountability.

results.title: Educated eye
results.brief_description: Visual awareness can be learned or acquired. Film is an ideal medium with which to explore the many ways of seeing. Some modes of seeing are important to life and survival; some enrich and expand our emotional and aesthetic lives. The educated eye is a creative eye. Each day can be an adventure in seeing - sometimes practical, often curious, exploring inner imagination, discovering beauty. Note: Contains some interesting images which now have a certain quality due to their age, eg American machinery and amusement park sequences in poster paint colors, reminiscent of Antonioni’s Zabriski Point.

results.title: Edgar Allan Poe
results.creator_credit: Stuart O'Brien and Arthur G. Evans
results.brief_description: One of the first American writers of international importance, Poe became a widely read master of the short story, yet his life seemed a fabric of despair, failure, frustration and poverty. This film presents a sympathetic account of Poe’s life and work narrated by Lorne Greene. To conclude there is a reading of Poe’s famous poem, ANNABEL LEE

results.title: Economics for elementary: trade
results.creator_credit: Ray Nanley, Arthur G. Evans, Art Evans Productions and Oxford Films
results.brief_description:
Explains the role of the middle-man in trade using the retailing of tomatoes as an example. shows the growing of the crop and the labour employed; the selling of the crop to the wholesaler (distributor); the wholesaler’s overheads and how he distributes to retail outlets such as supermarkets and markets.
Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Matalau: a Tolai Village in New Britain
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economic Change in a Developing Country”.
The last film in the series looks at a highly developed indigenous community - Matalau. Considers the impact Europeans have had on the traditional Tolai culture. Looks at the economy which is based on cash croppage - copra, cocoa, fishing and wage earning; and discusses future development.

results.title: Arou
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economic Change in a Developing Country”.
In this film, a map locates Arou, a tribal area of the Duna people, in the New Guinea highlands between the Central and Muller Ranges. The traditional economy of the people is shown to be almost self-sufficient. Sweet potatoes are the staple food and pigs are the main form of wealth. The lifting of entry restrictions in 1964 allowed European contact to be made with these people and the resulting changes in the economy and some problems now facing the Duna people are revealed. Suitable for Social Studies and Geography. No other credits available.

results.title: Economic change in a development country No.2: Wulukum
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Economic Change in a Developing Country”.
Discusses the socio-economic features of Wulukum, a Sepik village in the Torricelli Mountains, North-West New Guinea The film indicates the geographical location of the Wulukum village in the foothills of the Tarricelli Mountains near the Sepik River. It then shows how the changes have so far, provided little reinvestment of income into the village and that more positive changes will be required to stimulate further economic development.
